alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:10AM EST until February 18 at 2:46PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning and reach a crest near 31.0 feet this evening. The river should fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.0 feet on 02/26/1972. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST.
